issue.title: could not find requested file:  copy_shared_libraries.cmake
issue.body:
when I was compiling the OpenSpace under Windows and enabled the inclusion of OpenSpace-MinVR. But an error occurred when configuring vis Cmake: 
CMake Error at apps/OpenSpace-MinVR/CMakeLists.txt:25 (include):
  include could not find requested file:

    E:/Programs/OpenSpace/ext/ghoul/support/cmake/copy_shared_libraries.cmake

comment.body: Thanks Alex, hope it will recover soon.

issue.title: ESRI World Imagery not being cached when access through combo layer
issue.body:
When I enabled caching, and browse the earth, the Combo doens't show up in the cache, and the ESRI World Imagery folder doens't get larger, leading me to believe that the caching is not happening for the combo layer.

I would expect that with a combo layer the cache would go into the respective layers mrf

issue.title: Use the idle/interaction detection to cancel the countdown for exiting

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Extending the functionality of already existing features

labels.name: Component: Core
labels.description: Issues that are related to the core of OpenSpace

issue.body: To make it a bit harder to quit openspace by accident, we could make it so that when the countdown is going, if you use the mouse to control the camera, it cancels the countdown.

comment.body:
Ha - of course it does.  I'm a doofus. ⌘-Q my new best friend. Thanks. Just need to re-write my motor neurons. 

I'll start trying to use the add/remove lines more - I seem to recall there was something funky about the remove in the past, but maybe it's better now.

issue.title: Use the idle/interaction detection to cancel the countdown for exiting

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Extending the functionality of already existing features

labels.name: Component: Core
labels.description: Issues that are related to the core of OpenSpace

issue.body: To make it a bit harder to quit openspace by accident, we could make it so that when the countdown is going, if you use the mouse to control the camera, it cancels the countdown.

comment.body:
On Windows Alt+F4 _does_ close OpenSpace without going through the timer.   I'd assume that Apple+Q would do the same on MacOS as well.

Other possible solutions:
 - reduce the shutdown countdown to 0 (https://github.com/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/blob/master/openspace.cfg#L228)
 -  instead of restarting OpenSpace, you can unload the asset instead and then reload it.  If you drag-n-drop a file, the `ScriptLog` has for example a `openspace.asset.add("C:/Development/OpenSpace/data/assets/scene/solarsystem/sssb/astraea.asset")` in it;  if you replace the `add` with `remove`, so `openspace.asset.remove("C:/Development/OpenSpace/data/assets/scene/solarsystem/sssb/astraea.asset")` it will remove the asset and you can drag it back in again to reload without a restart

issue.title: Builder Mode

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Extending the functionality of already existing features

labels.name: Component: Core
labels.description: Issues that are related to the core of OpenSpace

issue.body:
Perhaps we should have a 'building mode' 

My first item is that when working on models, don't create a cache for the models, or create it in the tmp/. So that when you are building you can update the model without having to manually delete the cache file each time.

I'm sure we could come up with a list of other things to happen in 'building mode'

comment.body:
This could include not caching the models so they can be updated. 

Already implemented in the changes Jokim made for carter

issue.title: Build failure on all supported OSes
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

All operating systems fail to compile OpenSpace on the latest commit (63c339af581d3786f385b63bee043755eaccce7d).

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Clone OpenSpace
2. Run Cmake steps
3. Build
4. Build failure

**Expected behavior**

Build succeeds without error.

**Screenshots**

N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

 - OS:
   - Windows:
     - Windows Server 2019 (Visual Studio 16 2019)
     - Windows Server 2022 (Visual Studio 17 2022)
     - Windows 11 (Visual Studio 17 2022)
   - macOS:
     - macOS 12 Monterey
       - Compilers:
         - AppleClang 14.0.0.14000029
     - macOS 13 Ventura
       - Compilers:
         - AppleClang 14.0.3.14030022
         - AppleClang 15.0.0.15000040
     - macOS 14 Sonoma
       - Compilers:
         - AppleClang 15.0.0.15000040
   - Linux:
     - Ubuntu Linux 22.04
       - Compilers:
         - GCC: 11, 12, 13
         - Clang: 14, 15, 16, 17
 - Version: commit 63c339af581d3786f385b63bee043755eaccce7d

**Additional context**

Excerpt from a Ubuntu 22.04 runner with GCC 11, using Make as the generator, and pulling from APT repositories for Qt.

[ 73%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/openspace-core.dir/scene/asset.cpp.o
[ 73%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/openspace-core.dir/scene/assetmanager.cpp.o
In file included from /home/runner/work/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/ext/ghoul/include/ghoul/lua/lua_helper.h:612,
                 from /home/runner/work/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/include/openspace/properties/templateproperty.inl:25,

                 from <command-line>:

/home/runner/work/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/src/scene/assetmanager.cpp:540:70:   required from here
/home/runner/work/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/ext/ghoul/include/ghoul/lua/lua_helper.inl:983:33: error: static assertion failed: Unhandled type T
  983 |         static_assert(sizeof(T) == 0, "Unhandled type T");

/home/runner/work/OpenSpace/OpenSpace/ext/ghoul/include/ghoul/lua/lua_helper.inl:983:33: note: ‘(sizeof (std::optional<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char> >) == 0)’ evaluates to false
cc1plus: note: unrecognized command-line option ‘-Wno-unknown-attributes’ may have been intended to silence earlier diagnostics
gmake[3]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/openspace-core.dir/build.make:1693: src/CMakeFiles/openspace-core.dir/scene/assetmanager.cpp.o] Error 1
gmake[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2393: src/CMakeFiles/openspace-core.dir/all] Error 2

...
D:\a\OpenSpace\OpenSpace\ext\ghoul\include\ghoul\lua\lua_helper.inl(983,33): error C2338: static_assert failed: 'Unhandled type T' (compiling source file D:\a\OpenSpace\OpenSpace\src\scene\assetmanager.cpp) [C:\OpenSpace\build\src\openspace-core.vcxproj]

release.name: releases/v0.19.2
release.body:
# Content
 - Use the local image layer for Europa by default
 - Add the ability to specify a custom shader for the RenderableGalaxy class

# Bugfixes
 - Temporarily fix disappearing tiles on globe surfaces by disabling frustum culling
 - Fix naming mixup between umbral and penumbral shadow
 - Fixed an issue with the atmosphere shader code on Mac platforms
release.short_description_html:
Content

  • Use the local image layer for Europa by default
  • Add the ability to specify a custom shader for the RenderableGalaxy class

Bugfixes

  • Temporarily fix disappearing tiles on globe surfaces by…

payload.description: This is the official GitHub repository for OpenSpace: an open source astrovisualization project. For instructions on how to build and run OpenSpace, see the Getting Started Guides on the wiki page at http://wiki.openspaceproject.com

issue.title: Use the idle/interaction detection to cancel the countdown for exiting

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Extending the functionality of already existing features

labels.name: Component: Core
labels.description: Issues that are related to the core of OpenSpace

issue.body: To make it a bit harder to quit openspace by accident, we could make it so that when the countdown is going, if you use the mouse to control the camera, it cancels the countdown.

comment.body: Just for feedback purposes, this is now borderline annoying when building assets (i.e. requiring a lot of restarting OS), since now you have to wait the whole 3 seconds before alt-tabbing to a different application or else it cancels shutdown. I'll reduce the shutdown wait to alleviate the issue I guess? But it does make me wonder why can't OS just behave like normal software and require a 2-key combo to quit?
